resources.string: Power\nCalculator
Pc
DOMESTIC/OFFICES\nsuch as Refrigerators, Light Bulbs etc.
INDUSTRIAL/HIRE EQUIPMENT\nsuch as Stone Cutter etc.
GARDEN/DIY\nsuch as Lawn Mower, Rotavator etc
CARAVAN CAMPING\nsuch as Electrolux, Caravaner Kettle etc

People often make the mistake of assuming the generator bought is has the capacity to accommodate the total load applied on it but before deciding on a generator, it is important to consider ALL the appliance you may want to operate, how many will be used simultaneously and the TOTAL current consumption at any one time. Most appliances have a descriptive plate stating the current, usually in watts. IMPORTANT various electrical applications have very different power requirements, so it is essential to understand each particular need. For example TV sets, cookers, kettles and filament lamps have resistive loads, this means that their start up and operating currents are virtually the same - and as stated on the manufactured descriptive plate.
